[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Build] [Build Cache Confusion] Can multiple packages share the same 'build' directory, leading to cache confusion where bytecode from one package is incorrectly used for another? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Build] [Incremental Build Attack] Does the build system properly invalidate cached artifacts in the 'build' directory when source files change, or can stale malicious artifacts persist? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Manifest] [Manifest Substitution] Can an attacker create multiple Move.toml files at different directory levels that cause ambiguity about which manifest is authoritative? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Manifest] [Manifest Permissions] Does the code enforce strict file permissions on Move.toml to prevent world-writable manifests that could be modified by unprivileged attackers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Manifest] [TOML Parsing Vulnerability] After finding Move.toml via try_find_root(), could malformed TOML content exploit parsing vulnerabilities in the TOML parser? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Sources] [Source Directory Symlink] Can the 'sources' directory itself be a symlink pointing to attacker-controlled code outside the package directory? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Sources] [Source File Name Collision] Can an attacker create source files with names that collide with standard library modules (e.g., 'aptos_framework.move') to shadow trusted code? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Sources] [Non-Move File Inclusion] Does validation ensure only '.move' files exist in the 'sources' directory, or can attackers include executable scripts that get accidentally executed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Sources] [Source Directory Missing] If Sources is marked as non-optional but the directory doesn't exist, does the code fail safely or attempt to create it with insecure permissions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Tests] [Test Code Execution in Production] Can test code from the 'tests' directory be accidentally included in production builds, exposing debugging functionality or backdoors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Tests] [Test Directory Traversal] Since Tests is optional, can attackers exploit missing directory validation to place test files that execute with elevated privileges? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Scripts] [Script Execution Privilege] Can Move scripts in the 'scripts' directory be executed with higher privileges than regular transactions, leading to privilege escalation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Scripts] [Script Injection] If the 'scripts' directory is optional and user-controlled, can attackers inject malicious scripts that masquerade as legitimate package scripts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Examples] [Example Code in Production] Can example code from the 'examples' directory (marked for dev mode) leak into production, exposing insecure patterns or test keys? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Examples] [Example Module Shadowing] Can examples shadow production module names, causing the wrong code to be loaded in certain build configurations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Specifications] [Spec Bypass] Can attackers manipulate specification files in the 'specifications' directory to disable formal verification checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: Specifications] [Spec File Parsing] Does the specification file parser in the 'specifications' directory have input validation vulnerabilities that could be exploited? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Variant: DocTemplates] [Documentation Injection] Can malicious markdown or HTML in 'doc_templates' directory be used for XSS attacks when documentation is generated and viewed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Constant: REFERENCE_TEMPLATE_FILENAME] [Template File Substitution] Can an attacker replace the references.md template file to inject malicious content into generated documentation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Function: try_find_root()] [Filesystem Race Conditions] Can concurrent operations on the filesystem cause race conditions where try_find_root() finds a valid package root that is deleted before subsequent operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Function: path()] [Path Length Overflow] Can extremely long package directory names combined with path() outputs exceed filesystem path length limits, causing buffer overflows or truncation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Function: try_find_root()] [Network Path Handling] Can try_find_root() operate on UNC paths or network shares, potentially causing hangs or exposing credentials? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [Function: try_find_root()] [Container Escape] In containerized environments, can try_find_root() be exploited to escape the container by traversing to mounted host filesystems? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [All Functions] [Dependency Confusion] Can the package layout be manipulated to load malicious dependencies with names similar to internal packages? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package/src/source_package/layout.rs] [All Functions] [Git Submodule Traversal] If packages use git submodules, can layout functions be exploited to access submodule contents outside the package directory? (High)
